acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 24-hour LC50=53000microg/L of Crustacea (Brine shrimp)(AQUIRE, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Rabbit male: LD50 = 8300mg/kg, female: LD50 >14000mg/kg (DFGOTvol.11 (1996)). When guessed from 64.8% of content of this product, it became about 5378mg/kg and 9072mg/kg or more, respectively, and it was set as  the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: No death by 5200ppm = 27.7mg/L of 4-hour exposure with six rats (DFGOTvol.11, (1996)). Therefore, since LC50 >27.7mg/L and any example of mortality was not acknowledged, it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: LC50 (6h) >3600 - 3700ml/m3, i.e., LC50 (4h) >4352 - 4409ml/m3, is obtained based on description "1 of 10 rats died with 6 hour exposure to 3600 - 3700 ml/m3" (DFGOTvol.11, (1996)). Although which applied gaseous classification, Category could not be specified.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Rat male: LD50>14000 mg/kg, rat female:LD50>12000 mg/kg (DFGOTvol.11 (1996)). Guessed from 64.8% of content of this product, it became more than 9072 mg/kg and more than 7776 mg/kg respectively, and it was set as the outside of Category.

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on an animal experimentation (chemical pneumonia, etc.), though Dynamic viscosity: <=14 mm2/s.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (it hydrolyzed and acetic acid and pentanol are generated), and supposed less bio-accumulative (log Kow=2.3  (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: By the description, the ignition points is 375 degC (Hommmel (1991)), and it is over 70 degC.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale:
Since the presence of effects on reproductive functions or reproductive potential caused by exposure before pregnancy (premating) was not clear, it was referred to as "unclassifiable". 
In addition, in rat or rabbit organogenetic period administration test, it is observed of decrease weight gains of parent and decrease fetal weight and  fetal delayed ossification in high-dose rat, but adverse developmental effects to offsprings  as teratogenecity etc. is not observed in each species(DFGOTvol.11 (1996)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classified in UNRTDG No. 1104, Class: 3, PGIII

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There are corneal injury in eye of rabbit, but it was mild and reversible, and the result of having applied the isomer mixture to the eye of the rabbit were also mild (2nd of ten steps of stimulative scales) (ACGIH (2001)). Although effect on the eye of isomer mixture postexposure is also reported in humans (ACGIH (2001)), it is adapted by long run challenge. As mentioned above, since it was thought that irritating is slight, it was referred to as Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: The isomer mixture was classified as Category 3 based on the observation of two rabbit skin irritation tests (the isomer mixture used as the test substance): "slight stimulativeness" and "moderate erythema, slight dropsy, and slight scaling seven days after application" (DFGOTvol.11 (1996)). In addition, there is discription that "disappearance by volatilization of the remarkable rate of a study substance could be considered at the time of application" for the examination where repetitive application of the isomer mixture on human skin. And 197 subjects did not observe irritation at all (DFGOTvol.11 (1996)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since the result of the guinea pig maximization test, which used as its test substance the isomer mixture 60% of which consisted of this product, stated that "sensitizing potential of the test substance is at most slight," (DFGOTvol.11 (1996)).it was put outside of the Category. In addition, although there is a statement on a test which applied an isomer mixture to the human  skin, saying "Volatilization  may have caused a considerable amount of loss of the test substance during its application, " there is a fact that sensitization was not identified in any of all 197 subjects (DFGOTvol.11 (1996)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: There is a statement that visual field constriction is reported by part of humans who received occupation exposure of the isomer mixtures (DFGOT vol.11 (1996)) and also neurotoxicity is occurred (PATTY (5th, 2001)). Moreover, the histologically degeneration of the optic nerve is acknowledged in repeated exposure to the rabbit (DFGOTvol.11, (1996)). It wasclassified into Category 1 (nervous systems) according to these knowledge.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 3 Respiratory tract irritation, Narcotic effects
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In the inhalation exposure examination in humans, condition such as "nasal irritation" and "throat irritation" is seen immediately after (DFGOTvol.11 (1996)), and the consciousness may fall by high concentrations (ICSC (2000)). Moreover, the anesthetic actions is observed in inhalation exposure of the rat (ACGIH (2000)). So it is classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritation, anesthetic actions).
